column4: can someone please answer if they know? is there a way to remove kubuntu-desktop and kde packages to get back to a pure gnome install?
Yes.
an easier way than to reinstall? :-)
you just know that it's possible to completely wipe the kde packages, but not how?
that last one was for me I think? thanks
one last Q. you say 'get the list of dependencies in kubuntu bot not ubuntu'. Is this a manual job, or a command line job?
A command line job, let me try something quickly...
Try this command http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/32706/
Are you confortable with the terminal?
yep. thanks. will have to switch to ubuntu first. I want to keep a couple of things. amarok is one. should  just run your line and reinstall afterwards?
Yes, that would probably be easiest.
ok. off I go. I'll report back :-)
and I'm all gnome again :-D , thanks for helping out
np, I just ran apt-get install kubuntu and copied the packages it said it would intall then put apt-get remove in front of it :)
ahh. I should've thought about that.
But you would have needed a system without kubuntu-desktop installed to do it, kind of catch 22.
that's true :-)
By the way, if you install using the alternate CD in edgy you can just apt-get autoremove kubuntu , but for some reason that won't work for liveCD installs.
ok. hope I will never need to do it ;-)
But since you installed ubuntu-desktop post install you can go back any time with apt-get autoremove ubuntu-desktop.
You can't mount ext2/3 from OSx and you can't mount hfs+ RW on Linux unless you turn off journaling :(
